choices.text:
in python make a plot that compares two columns in a dataframe.
To compare two columns in a pandas DataFrame, you can use the `plot()` method and specify which column to plot on each axis using the `x` and `y` parameters respectively. Here's an example code snippet that creates a scatter plot of two columns in a dataframe named "df":
```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from pandas import DataFrame, Series
# create sample data frame with 2 columns
df = DataFrame({"col1": [1, 2, 3], "col2": [4, 5, 6]})
# plot col1 vs col2 using scatter plot
plt.scatter(df["col1"], df["col2"])
plt.xlabel("Col1")
plt.ylabel("Col2")
plt.title("Scatter Plot of Col1 and Col2")
plt.show()
```
This code will create a scatter plot with the x-axis labeled "Col1" and y-axis labeled "Col2". The title of the plot is set to "Scatter Plot of Col1 and Col2".
